definition:
We say that a function $f\colon A\to B$ is *injective* or *one-to-one*
if $f(x)=f(y)$ implies $x=y$, or equivalently, whenever $x\neq y$, then
$f(x)\neq f(y)$.

### Properties {#properties .unnumbered}

1.  Suppose $A,B,C$ are sets and $f\colon A\to B$, $g\colon B\to C$ are
    injective functions. Then the composition $g\circ f$ is an
    injection.

2.  Suppose $f\colon A\to B$ is an injection, and $C\subseteq A$. Then
    the restriction $f|_C\colon C\to B$ is an injection.

For a list of other of injective functions, see [@wiki].

[9]{} Wikipedia, article on .
